1594553128_1L4dZcDF2maSKHDy788yhxpYnBWnX.body:
> Import only available in paid plan
> Bridge only available in paid plan
> Filters only available in paid plan

It's almost as if Gmail can only offer you a fully fledged e-mail service for "free" because you're paying them with your privacy and they're getting paid with cash for selling your data. There's only three options:

1) You pay for your e-mail service.
2) You run your own e-mail service.
3) You don't use an e-mail service.

And Google has been doing their darndest to 2) as hard as possible by automatically adding amateur e-mail services to their spam filter, but there's some guides online on how to improve your chances.
